title: Prepare app for public publish and finalize branding (Instant Movie Director)

requirements.text: Update the app’s visible branding to use the app name “Instant Movie Director” consistently, including the header logo text and the browser tab title.

quotes: The afternoon movie called instant movie director

acceptanceCriteria: Header brand text no longer shows “Production Studio” and instead shows “Instant Movie Director”.
The HTML document title no longer shows “Prompt-driven Movie Production Team Workspace” and instead shows “Instant Movie Director”.
All user-facing text added/changed for this requirement is in English.

requirements.text: Add a simple in-app “Publish” / “Deployment” help surface that explains how to deploy this project as a live Internet Computer app (local deploy and mainnet deploy), including the exact commands a developer should run and what artifacts/IDs to expect.

quotes: Nope I think it's ready to go I think I would like to make this a live app

acceptanceCriteria: The app UI contains an obvious way to open a “Publish” / “Deployment” help view (e.g., from the footer or header).
The help view includes clear step-by-step instructions for deploying on the Internet Computer, covering both local development deployment and IC mainnet deployment.
The instructions are fully readable without external links (links may be included but are not required to understand the steps).
All user-facing text added/changed for this requirement is in English.

requirements.text: Add repository documentation for publishing: create or update a deployment guide file (e.g., DEPLOYMENT.md) that documents prerequisites, build steps, deployment steps, and common troubleshooting notes for making the app publicly accessible on the Internet Computer.
acceptanceCriteria: A deployment guide file exists in the repo and includes: prerequisites, local deploy steps, mainnet deploy steps, and basic troubleshooting.
The guide does not instruct using unsupported hosting providers or external databases/services.
The guide references the app name “Instant Movie Director” in user-facing contexts.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo (no additional backend services).
Only generate backend/migration.mo if an upgrade requires state migration (conditional migration policy).

Do not edit files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or anything under frontend/src/components/ui (compose instead).
Do not add third-party authentication providers; only Internet Identity is supported.
nonGoals: Adding new creative workflow features (prompts, assembly, export) beyond what already exists.
Integrating external hosting (AWS/GCP/Azure/Vercel/Netlify) or external databases.
Adding payments, email, push notifications, or real-time WebSocket features.
